content: chantrelle mushroom ornament co 4 sts on 4mm needles yo k1 until the end of the round 8sts knit yo k1 until the end of the round 16 sts knit yo k1 until the end of the round 32 sts knit yo k1 until the end of the round 64 sts knit purl purl you now have two distinctive rounds of purl bumps to fold knit k2tog k1 until the last 2 sts k2 43 knit k2tog k1 until the last 2 sts k2 29 knit k2tog k2 until the last 5 sts k2tog k3 22 knit k2tog k2 until the last 2 k2tog 16 sts pull the tail from the co through the middle and then through the 16 stitches on your needles so the right sides stockinette sides with the purl rounds are facing out at the same time leave them on the needle so you bring the inside down to make the distinctive chanterelle shape don t stuff the top you can find image step by step at the end of the pattern -you can also choose to make this a loop so you hang the ornament from this tail or you can tie a loop later once the tail is secure continue knitting in the round for the stem as follows stem knit 4 rounds 16 k2tog k1 until the last 2 k2tog 10 knit 4 rounds 10 k2tog k1 until the end of the round 6 stuff the stem very gently with poly filling or scrap yarn just to give it a slight 3d dimension cut so you have a 7cm tail and using a tapestry needle thread through the remaining stitches a few rounds so you create a sturdy slightly square base before threading it into the inside of your work step one take your co tail and thread it through a tapestry needle step two thread through the co stitches to make a loop to hang the ornament you can omit this step if you prefer making a loop later step three decide your preferred loop depth step four wrap your yarn around the base of the loop and tie a knot so it is secure step five with your needle guiding thread the remaining tail through the top center step six pull the needle out in through the center of your live stitches and be sure to not trap your working yarn step seven thread the tail into your live stitches while they remain on your needle so that the cap of the mushroom sits flat and ruffles up as one piece continue knitting from this point in magic loop or on double pointed needles from the stem section
